thread.title: Jake Coker explains why beating Tennessee matters
thread.title_full: Jake Coker explains why beating Tennessee matters | AL.com

author: Michael Casagrande | mcasagrande@al.com
title: Jake Coker explains why beating Tennessee matters
text:
You could tell this one meant a lot to Jake Coker.
He'd just completed 21 of 27 passes for 247 yards in Alabama's 19-14 gut-check over Tennessee . The senior had two huge completions in the final drive to overcome a fourth-quarter deficit.
So was it his defining moment?
"I don't know about that," he said. "I think the guys around me made big plays. They made it a lot easier to get them the ball. They weren't perfect balls, but those guys made plays."
Coker's also an Alabama native, so he knows what beating Tennessee nine straight years means.
"It means a lot," he said. "Coach Saban always said this is one you're going to live with the rest of your life. To me, or all of us really, to get that done, it's great."
Did he get emotional?
"I didn't cry or anything," he said with a grin, "but it meant a lot to me."
Watch the rest of Coker's postgame chat with reporters above.
